intro: Brunellia sibundoya subsp. antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian sibundoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia, specifically in the departments of Antioquia and Chocó. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. The subspecies is distinguished by its leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the *Brunellia* genus.
